DataElement.preferredName: NMYC Gene Amplification Next Generation Sequencing Panel Study Test Comments Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free-text field to describe the amplification of MYCN identified by the next generation sequencing panel study laboratory procedure.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: NMYC Gene Amplification Next Generation Sequencing Panel Study Test
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A molecular genetic abnormality indicating the presence of multiple copies of the MYCN gene._Technologies that facilitate the rapid determination of the nucleotide sequence of large numbers of strands or segments of DNA or RNA._A type of longitudinal study where the same participants are used through the study period, often over a long period of time._A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A molecular genetic abnormality indicating the presence of multiple copies of the MYCN gene.

Concepts.definition: A molecular genetic abnormality indicating the presence of multiple copies of the MYCN gene.

Concepts.definition: Technologies that facilitate the rapid determination of the nucleotide sequence of large numbers of strands or segments of DNA or RNA.
A type of longitudinal study where the same participants are used through the study period, often over a long period of time.
A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.
